His best knock in the tournament came against West Indies, a 91-ball 100 that helped 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿 seal a thrilling one-wicket win in Bridgetown. https://t.co/dlHBMhNbxh Pietersen was equally ferocious in ODIs that year, smashing his first ton in the format – a 96-ball 108* – against South Africa in Bloemfontein.

He followed that knock with two more centuries in the seven-match series. https://t.co/rDkBHpTfM7 In the 2005 #Ashes, his debut Test series, Pietersen finished as the highest run-scorer.

His best knock came in the fifth Test at The Oval – a sparkling 158 in the second innings, scored after the rest of 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿's middle-order succumbed, holding Australia to a draw. https://t.co/dngl7662Wx Kevin Pietersen was one of the finest batsmen to represent England.
